config_description: If false, only confirmed mismatches will be reported. If true, a separate metric for unconfirmed mismatches will also be recorded. This is to avoid potential signal:noise issues are unconfirmed mismatches are less actionable than confirmed ones.
developer_understanding_on_working: The configuration 'report_unconfirmed_repaired_data_mismatches' is used to determine whether unconfirmed mismatches should be reported along with confirmed mismatches. If the configuration is set to true, a separate metric for unconfirmed mismatches will be recorded in addition to confirmed ones.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The triggering frequency of the 'report_unconfirmed_repaired_data_mismatches' configuration depends on the number of mismatches detected in the system. If there are multiple mismatches detected, the configuration will be triggered to determine whether to report unconfirmed mismatches.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the 'report_unconfirmed_repaired_data_mismatches' configuration option is that it allows for more detailed tracking of mismatches in the system. By recording unconfirmed mismatches separately, the system can differentiate between actionable confirmed mismatches and less actionable unconfirmed ones, helping to reduce potential signal-to-noise issues.
